description.hltext_display: Rentner stirbt nach Unfall im Krankenhaus
Spadają ceny miedzi
description.content:
Ceny miedzi w Londynie, Szanghaju i Nowym Jorku spadają, inwestorzy wyprzedają kontrakty.
Ceny miedzi na giełdzie metali w Londynie podczas tej sesji spadają, bo niektórzy inwestorzy przystąpili do wyprzedaży kontraktów, oceniając, że ostatnie solidne zwyżki cen były zbyt gwałtowne - podają maklerzy. Miedź w dostawach trzymiesięcznych na giełdzie metali w Londynie jest wyceniana na 9.308,25 USD za tonę, po spadku o 0,6 proc.
Na giełdzie w Szanghaju tona miedzi w dostawach na marzec zniżkuje podczas tej sesji o 0,7 proc. do 68.800 juanów za tonę.
var _r = document.referrer ? encodeURIComponent(document.referrer) : ''; var _w = encodeURIComponent(document.location.href); var _e = document.inputEncoding ? document.inputEncoding : document.charset; document.write('\/script'); Kontrakty na Comex w Nowym Jorku na miedź spadają teraz o 0,5 proc. do 4,2540 USD za funt, po wzroście wcześniej do rekordowych 4,2965 USD za funt.
Analitycy oceniają, że wszystko teraz wskazuje na możliwe wzrosty cen miedzi do końca roku i mało jest czynników, które mogłyby to zahamować, chyba że na świecie dojdzie do jakiegoś poważnego szoku w gospodarce.
Ale w tym momencie raczej wydaje się to niemożliwe - uważa Yang Tao, analityk Baocheng Futures Co. w Zhejiang.

description.hltext_display: Area roundup: Murray, Northwest will meet for 'Classic' title tonight
description.content:
Zach England led Murray County’s boys basketball team in scoring and helped spur the defense Tuesday to shut down Heritage-Catoosa, 73-56, and advance to the championship game of the Farm Bureau Christmas Classic against host Northwest Whitfield.
England scored 22 points and added seven assists as the Indians downed their Region 7-3A foes for the second time this season.
The eight-team tournament concludes today with Murray County (10-1) in the championship at 8:30 p.m. Northwest (5-6) defeated Chattanooga Central, 69-41, in the winner’s bracket nightcap to find its way to the championship.
Central (3-6) will play Heritage (8-3) in the third-place game at 7 p.m. Dalton (5-3) won its game in the loser’s bracket to advance to the fifth-place game against Adairsville (5-5) at 5:30 p.m. North Murray will face First Presbyterian Day in the seventh-place game at 4 p.m.
In the Indians’ ninth straight win, England scored four buckets off steals in the second quarter as Murray grew a four-point lead after the first quarter to a 36-23 edge by halftime.
“Zach is our engine,” Indians coach Greg Linder said. “He was able to turn defensive plays into offensive scoring opportunities.
“His little spurt was huge in the second quarter.”
Blake Hammontree, Chase Jones and Adam Spivey all battled with foul trouble throughout the game, and each picked up their fourth in the final period. But the Murray County bench was able to sustain and build the lead to 52-36 by the end of the third.
“With our depth, we were able to keep up the pressure,” Linder said. “Then when we came back with those guys, we were able to put them away.”
Taylor Patterson added 19 points and five rebounds for Murray. Jake Raines led the Generals with 16 points, and Riley Sparks added 15.
The Indians faced Heritage in the Ridgeland Thanksgiving tournament to open the season with Murray County winning, 62-54 and handing the Generals two of their three losses this season.
Murray County has already swept the regular-season series against the Bruins, winning 50-36 at Tunnel Hill and holding off Northwest, 62-58, in Chatsworth.
But by advancing to the championship in the first-year tournament, the Bruins earned another shot at their border rivals.
“So far we’re holding up our end of the bargain,” Northwest coach Ryan Richards said. “It’s a great opportunity for us to play Murray County for a third time this season.”
• Northwest boys 69, Chattanooga Central 41: After trailing by seven points to open the game, the Bruins turned the game around and cruised to the win.
“We were down 9-2, and we called a timeout and talked to the kids,” Richards said. “Then we got rolling. We started to get a little more aggressive and got into a great flow. We led 19-11 by the end of the first quarter.”
Tanner Quarles hit five 3-pointers to lead the Bruins with 15 points. Colter Creswell added 14 points and seven rebounds. Jarrett Bruce also reached double figures in scoring with 10.
“We got into our press a little bit,” Richards said. “That got us some transition baskets.”
• Dalton boys 66, FPD 40: Although the Vikings found early success with shots on the perimeter, the Catamounts made defensive adjustments to shut down the Macon school.
FPD (3-7) hit four 3-pointers by the end of the first quarter to hold down Dalton’s lead, 19-14.
“Once we started to rotate the backside of our press we stopped them from getting the 3s,” Cats coach Mike Duffie said. “And I think we kind of wore them down. We had 10 people out there.”
The Vikings also had trouble penetrating the front side of Dalton’s press in the second quarter as well.
Tristen Harrell and Tre Beck helped the Cats pull away combining to take three steals back for layups, including Beck’s steal and pass to Harrell with just more than one minute to go in the half to push the lead to 36-23.
Dalton also grabbed 22 offensive rebounds, led by Harrell’s seven, to help pull ahead by 20 points by the third quarter, and FPD never got closer, making just two field goals in the second half.
Harrell paced the Cats with 23 points. Watts Dantzler added 18 points, and Beck finished with 10.
After going 0-for-5 at the foul line Monday, Dalton improved to 10 of 20 against the Vikings.
Shaque Robinson led the Cats’ attack on the boards overall with nine, and Floyd Coffey added eight.
• Adairsville boys 50, North Murray 47: Zach Vess led the Mountaineers with 13 points, but the Tigers pulled ahead for the win in the bout between Region 7-2A foes.
North Murray (5-6), which is in its first year playing a region schedule, is going through some growing pains, Mountaineers coach Eric Bishop said.
“Last year we played a total of 14 games in a JV schedule,” Bishop said. “This year we’ve already played close to that. I anticipated we’d have a lull. We’re just not used to playing this much ball.”
Jeremy Smith also scored 11 points for North Murray, and Brady Swilling added 10.
• Christian Heritage girls 60, Notre Dame-Chattanooga 41: A day after suffering their first loss of the season, the Lady Lions rebounded with a victory and finished their time at Howard of Chattanooga’s Christmas tournament with a split.
Maggie Peeples scored 28 points and had five steals to lead Christian Heritage (9-1), which suffered an 11-point loss to Cane Ridge of Nashville, Tenn., on Monday.
“We felt good about that game even though it was a loss,” Lady Lions coach Heather Lowery said. “They were a tough team, and if we got to play them again, we feel like we could win. They were quick, and (Notre Dame) was quick. They played a lot of man-to-man on us, but we reacted well.”
Ann Marie Massengale added 10 points and six rebounds for Christian Heritage — which won’t compete again until Jan. 4 in a GISA Region 4-2A game at Douglasville’s Harvester Christian — while Rebecca Leonard and Cierra Chaney each chipped in seven points.
Allyson Ross paced Notre-Dame with 10 points.
Fatigue was something the Lady Lions had to deal with after playing four games in five days, and it led to “several missed layups,” Lowery said. But she believes the tournament experience on top of back-to-back region games last weekend will be a plus in the long run.
“We realized from this tournament some things we’ve got to go back and look at and put our focus on, such as rebounding,” Lowery said. “We didn’t rebound well this tournament ... but it was great for us to play bigger schools and tougher teams to get us ready to go into January. We’re playing really good defense right now, and that’s what we’ve got to continue to push.”
• Douglas County girls 68, North Murray 24: Meagan Spivey and Grace Phillips each had six points as the Lady Mountaineers (2-9) went quiet on offense during their second day at the Gilmer Christmas Shootout in Ellijay.
LaFara Spriggs’ 19-point effort led all scorers, while Christin Mercer added 17 for Region 5-4A’s Lady Tigers, who are 8-0 according to results posted at Ga.PrepCountry.com.
Mercer is being recruited by Georgia, among other schools, Robinette said, and teammate Kristina Wells — she had just four points against North Murray — has already signed with Kennesaw State.
“They’re legit,” North Murray coach Keith Robinette said. “They’re good. They’re real fast and athletic, and their athleticism makes a lot of things difficult offensively. A lot of their stuff came out of transition, because they’re ultra fast.
“But it’s great to go against those teams, because if we can execute against that speed it will help us later on. Our girls played hard, though, they weren’t just going through the motions. We fought all night and I was pleased with that.”
Wrestling
• North Murray 39, LFO 34: With the Mountaineers (11-5) trailing by a point heading into the final match, freshman 125-pounder Elias Lechuga picked up a pin to secure the dual victory at Lakeview-Fort Oglethorpe.
“That’s the second time in three matches it’s come down to his victory,” Mountaineers coach Steve Colley said. “Against Rockmart he came through with a pin, and he pinned this kid today with a standing cradle, which is one of our signature moves.”
Jonathan Dunn (103 pounds) another freshman, also won by pin, while Austin Carter (189) won by decision. Brandon Patterson (119), Armando Rodriguez (135), Seth Stainton (140) and Jackie Abernathy (145) all accepted forfeits.
Several other wrestlers made a difference by avoiding being pinned, said Colley, who started four backups in the dual, which was originally scheduled for last week before being postponed because of inclement weather.
North Murray won’t compete again until next Wednesday’s Ringgold Duals. The Mountaineers have also added the following day’s Rockmart Invitational to their schedule.
• Dalton coach Charles Mitchell did not return a message seeking results from his team, which was scheduled to wrestle at the Vandergriff Duals in Hixson, Tenn., by The Daily Citizen’s deadline.

description.hltext_display: Vật Liệu Nguyên Tử Tại Yemen Không Được Bảo Vệ
description.content:
CAIRO - 1 cơ sở tồn trữ vật liệu nguyên tử không đuợc canh giữ trong gần 1 tuần lễ sau khi người gác duy nhất bị thuyên chuyển và máy thu hình theo dõi an ninh bị hỏng, theo 1 công điện của Bộ ngoại giao mà WikiLeaks thẩm lậu hôm Thứ Hai và báo The Guardian tại Anh tường thuật - trong 1 công điện ghi ngày 9-1, viên chức Yemen mà danh tính đã bị lấy đi đã báo cáo tình trạng kể trên và vận động toà ĐS Hoa Kỳ yêu cầu chính quyền Yemen bảo vệ vật liệu nguyên tử.
Công điện dẫn lời viên chức nói rằng "Hiện hầu như không có gì đứng giữa kẻ xấu và vật liệu nguyên tử".
Yemen là nươc nghèo nhất trong thế giới Arap, cũng là nơi có căn cứ của chi nhánh al-Qaeda không chỉ tấn công chính quyền trong nước mà còn đánh lại Hoa Kỳ, gồm vụ nổ bom bất thành trên phi cơ đang bay tới Detroit.
Ngày 7-1, tức 2 ngày trước công điện nêu trên, ngoại trưởng Abu Bakr al-Qirbi thông báo ĐS Hoa Kỳ rằng không còn vật liệu nguyên tử cất giữ tại thủ đô Sanaa, và mọi phế phẩm nguyên tử đã chở sang Syria.
Công điện của Bộ ngoại giao Hoa Kỳ giải thích : vật liệu phóng xạ tồn trữ đã đuợc xử dụng trong phòng nghiên cứu của trường đại học, trong nghiên cứu nông nghiệp, bệnh viện và các công ty dầu quốc tế - người gác duy nhất không còn làm việc từ ngày 30-12-2009 và máy thu hình an ninh đã bị hỏng từ giữa năm 2009. Phóng viên không thể dò hỏi với viên chức hữu trách của Yemen.

description.hltext_display: To kvæstet i sammenstød i Karup
description.content:
Et sammenstød mellem tre biler i Karup gav problemer for pendlerne mellem Herning og Viborg.
To personer blev kvæstet i et sammenstød tidligt onsdag morgen i Karup, oplyser Sydøstjyllands Politi.
Ulykken skete i midtbyen på hovedfærdselsåren mellem Herning og Viborg. Tre timer efter sammenstødet var krydset Nygade/Viborgvej stadig spærret for trafikken, som måtte ledes udenom med forsinkelser til følge.
Sammenstødet skete mellem en personbil og to lastbiler, hvoraf den ene indeholdt 50 ton majs. En del af majsen røg ud på kørebanen ved sammenstødet, der begyndte, da en mindre lastbil svingede ind foran lastbilen med majs.
Føreren af lastbilen mistede herredømmet og stødte ind i en modkørende personbil. Personbilens fører blev kvæstet, da bilen blev trykket ind i en have og endte mod et træ. Også føreren af lastbilen med majs blev kvæstet, men politiet har ingen nærmere oplysninger om de kvæstedes tilstand. Der skulle dog ikke være tale om livsfare.

description.hltext_display: Japan quake sparks tsunami scare, evacuation
description.content:
TOKYO: Scores of villagers on a remote Japanese island chain in the Pacific scrambled for higher ground early Wednesday after a major 7.4-magnitude offshore quake sparked a tsunami alert.
The seabed tremor struck at 2:19 am local time (1719 GMT Tuesday), jolting people out of bed as loudspeakers blared across the Ogasawara islands and authorities warned of the risk of a two-metre (six-foot) high local tsunami.
The tsunami alert was later downgraded and all warnings were lifted five hours after the quake hit near the islands, some 1,000 kilometres (600 miles) south of Tokyo. No injuries or damage were reported.
But about 120 people temporarily evacuated to higher ground on Chichi-shima island and some 50 people on Haha-shima island, Koji Watanabe, a village official on Chichi-shima, said overnight.
"It was the biggest earthquake I have ever felt," said Masae Nagai, a hotel owner on Chichi-shima, part of the remote archipelago also called the Bonin islands, which has a population of about 2,300.
"We were awakened by the quake. It was scary," she told AFP by telephone around sunrise, but she added that the walls of her hotel were not cracked and that "things have returned to normal".
Local authorities on the Ogasawara islands, near Iwo Jima, said they had set up five shelters for residents but had closed them before sunrise in the absence of damage reports.
"The jolts were relatively stronger than those we have felt in the past," Kenichi Mochida, another Chichi-shima official, told AFP. "But there was no panic as people acted in an orderly manner."
Yoshihiro Ikeda, vice principal of the Ogasawara Elementary School with 123 pupils in Chichi-shima, said: "We were worried about our students as the jolt was quite strong and lasted very long.
"But we were relieved to confirm that none of our students were injured and no facilities were damaged. I guess we were quite lucky, considering the size of the quake."
The quake hit at a shallow depth of 14 kilometres, 153 kilometres (95 miles) east of Chichi-shima, and was followed by a series of aftershocks measuring between 5.3 and 5.6 which continued into the morning.
About three hours after the quake, a 60 centimetre (two feet) wave was monitored 700 kilometres away at Hachijo-jima, part of the Izu island chain that runs south of Tokyo, the meteorological agency said.
Waves of up to 20 centimetres also reached the southwestern Japanese main islands, the agency said.
The Ogasawara chain, made up of more than 30 subtropical and tropical islets some 240 kilometres north of Iwo Jima, were put under the control of the United States after World War II, and returned to Japan in 1968.
The remote islands have preserved their unique biological habitats and have been dubbed the "Galapagos of the Orient".
The Hawaii-based Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said after sounding the initial alert there was no threat of a destructive widespread tsunami and no nearby islands were thought to be in the tsunami danger zone.
But it warned in a bulletin shortly after the quake: "Earthquakes of this size sometimes generate local tsunamis that can be destructive along coasts located within 100 kilometres of the earthquake epicentre."
When a massive 8.8-magnitude quake, one of the most powerful on record, struck off Chile's coast in February, Japan issued its top tsunami alert and ordered more than half a million people to evacuate seaside areas.
Authorities later apologised after a wave of 120 centimetres hit and caused no injuries.
Around 20 percent of the world's most powerful earthquakes strike Japan, which sits on the "Ring of Fire" surrounding the Pacific Ocean.
In 1995 a magnitude-7.2 quake in the port city of Kobe killed 6,400 people. But high building standards, regular drills and a sophisticated tsunami warning system mean that casualties are often minimal.

description.hltext_display: Man gets nearly 20 years in Haiti sex abuse case
description.content:
A Colorado man was sentenced to nearly 20 years in prison Tuesday for sexually abusing children for more than a decade at a school he founded in Haiti, including some who faced him in the courtroom and testified that he threatened to put them back on the streets if they did not submit to his advances.
Judge Janet Bond Arterton called Douglas Perlitz a serial rapist and molester as she imposed the sentence in New Haven federal court. She said she believed he would commit the same crimes again if he were in a similar position.
Perlitz, 40, apologized to his victims while speaking in Creole before the sentence was handed down. He said he knew his crimes were horrible but pleaded for leniency nevertheless, asking the judge to consider the good work he did in the impoverished Caribbean nation.
"I began losing my head. ... I was using you," Perlitz said while facing the six young men who testified earlier. "I mistreated you because you were afraid. Perhaps you were confused. Perhaps you thought, 'How could this man, Douglas, who's protecting me, be touching me like this?'
"I wasn't thinking about you or your feelings or how my actions would affect you," he added. "I'm asking for forgiveness."
More than 100 people filled the courtroom including the victims, two Haitian police officers and Perlitz's family and supporters.
Perlitz admitted in August that he engaged in illicit sexual conduct with eight children who attended the Project Pierre Toussaint School for homeless children in Cap-Haitien. Prosecutors said Perlitz gave the children money, food, clothing and electronics and threatened to take everything away and expel them from the program if they told anyone.
Arterton said she believed there were at least 16 victims, based on testimony that authorities recorded on video by others who attended the school. Some of the six young Haitian men said in court that dozens of other boys were abused by Perlitz.
Now a resident of Eagle, Colo., Perlitz founded the school in 1997 when he lived in Fairfield County, Conn. Authorities said he began abusing the children, some as young as 11, in 1998 before the school was built. The abuse scandal led to the collapse of the school and its fundraising arm, the Haiti Fund, forcing the children back into homelessness on the streets, prosecutors said.
In court documents, Perlitz said one factor in the crimes was his "dark and abusive relationship" with a priest _ whom authorities have not named _ he met while attending Fairfield University.
The six young men were flown to Connecticut and detailed the abuse they suffered.
"He always told me, `Don't tell anybody about it. If you tell anybody about it, I will put you out on the street,'" one victim said through a Creole interpreter. He said Perlitz first abused him in 1998 and once sodomized him after plying him with rum.
Another victim said Perlitz started abusing him on his 14th birthday in 2004. He said he struggled with feelings of shame and thought about suicide, especially when he read the Bible.
"I am here today to tell the truth. Because of the truth, I can find justice," he said. "He hurt us a lot."
Perlitz was arrested last year and pleaded guilty to travel with intent to engage in illicit sexual conduct, a crime that carries up to 30 years in prison.
Prosecutors had asked the judge for a prison sentence of nearly 20 years, saying Perlitz preyed on some of the world's most vulnerable: Haitian street children with little or no family support or education.
"The damage and the harm he has done is just so extraordinary in this case," Assistant U.S. Attorney Krishna Patel told the judge. "He should be punished for the fact that he did this to the world's most defenseless children. He is a danger to our children. He's a danger to the world's children."
Perlitz's lawyers asked for a sentence of about eight years, saying that Perlitz also helped many children.
William Dow III, one of Perlitz's lawyers, drew jeers from some in the courtroom when he said Perlitz "lifted up" many poor children and treated them well. Dow quickly added that Perlitz "committed crimes. There's no question about it."
Dow urged Arterton to not sentence Perlitz as the "monster" that prosecutors portrayed him as.
"It's a tragedy on a whole bunch of levels," Dow said. "This is a significantly flawed man who has made good."
Perlitz's lawyers also wrote in court documents that he had "confusion and shame about his sexuality, and struggles with his identity; an ongoing, complicated and exploitive relationship with an influential priest; and increasing isolation and pressure while in Haiti."
Arterton also said Perlitz would have to serve 10 years supervised release after prison, register as a sex offender, receive sex offender treatment and not have any unsupervised contact with minors.
Perlitz said he would like to continue helping people.
"They say a convicted sex offender has no future, but I would like to try to prove people wrong," he said.

description.hltext_display: Fire levels Mesachie Lake home
description.content:
Members of the Mesachie Lake Fire Department work at putting out a house fire on Bear Lake Road, Monday, December 20.
Tyler Clarke
Recommend on Facebook
others also read...
Updated: December 21, 2010 7:04 PM
Two dogs died during an early morning fire in the Mesachie Lake community, Monday, December 20.
Mesachie Lake residents woke up at 7:31 a.m. to the sound of the community’s fire sirens
Fire and other emergency crews arrived at the flaming Bear Lake Road home shortly thereafter.
Mesachie Lake fire chief Nick Sohye said that no one was in the house during the fire.
“It was all fine when they left this morning,” he said.
Although the trailer-style house had a wood stove, Sohye said that his crew has yet to determine the cause of the fire.
The Mesachie Lake Fire Department had 10 members on site battling the fire.
The house is believed to be owned by Bill and Glenna Bergen, who were unavailable for comment.

description.hltext_display: Anh: 12 Người Bị Bắt Vì Âm Mưu Tấn Công Khủng Bố Lớn
description.content:
LONDON - Cảnh sát vương quốc Anh vừa vây bắt 12 người tình nghi âm mưu 1 trận tấn công khủng bố quy mô - 12 người bị bắt ở thành phố Manchester hồi Tháng 4-2009 là vụ lớn nhất trước đây.
Cảnh sát xông vào nhà trước bình minh, các nghi can không vũ trang có nghĩa là âm mưu chưa sẵn sàng - họ bị bắt tại London, tại thành phố Cardiff thuộc xứ Wales và các thành phố Birmingham, Stoke-on-Trent thuộc xứ England.
Ông John Yates, viên chức của cảnh sát chống khủng bố cho hay các mục tiêu tấn công là trong vương quốc, và không mô tả chi tiết.
Các nghi can thuộc hạng tuổi từ 17 đến 28 và cảnh sát có thời hạn 28 ngày để truy tố hay là phóng thích các nghi can.
Trong Tháng 10, Hoa Kỳ khuyến cáo công dân cảnh giác đề phòng trong lúc du lịch châu Âu - theo 1 viên chức an ninh ẩn danh của Anh : vụ 12 nghi can này không phải là 1 phần trong âm mưu tấn công trong muà lễ cuối năm, tuy châu Âu từng là mục tiêu tấn công của khủng bố trong thời gian qua, như hệ thống xe điện của thủ đô Madrid bị tấn công năm 2004 gây thiệt mạng 191 người và khoảng 1 năm sau, xe bus và xe điện tại London bị tấn công, 52 người chết.
Hôm Thứ Hai, viên chức ẩn danh tuyên bố "Cuộc vây bắt tình nghi khủng bố không nhất thiết có liên quan với 1 âm mưu lớn". Ông Yates nói "Đây là 1 cuộc hành quân tình báo lớn, có chuẩn bị trước, có sự dự phần của 5, 6 lực lượng".

description.hltext_display: Boykins, Bucks take down Lakers
description.content:
Earl Boykins poured in a season-high 22 points off the bench, as the Milwaukee Bucks took down the Los Angeles Lakers, 98-79.
John Salmons added 20 points and six assists for the Bucks, who snapped a three-game skid. Ersan Ilyasova donated 17 points and 11 rebounds for Milwaukee, which got 15 points and eight boards from Andrew Bogut.
"Yesterday, I didn't shoot well," Boykins said. "My legs were stronger today and I got into a rhythm. Last night, we were embarrassed. We came out with energy tonight."
Kobe Bryant finished with 21 points for the Lakers, who saw a five-game winning streak come to an end. Pau Gasol tallied 15 points and 11 rebounds, while Lamar Odom had 12 points, 10 rebounds and six assists in defeat.
The Bucks held a 25-22 edge after 12 minutes of action, and took a 50-46 lead into the locker room.
Things remained tight in the third quarter, but Salmons made two free throws and a jumper to give Milwaukee a 72-66 margin heading to the fourth.
Gasol had the Lakers within five, 77-72, with under eight minutes to play, but the Bucks put the game away from there.
Boykins started an 8-0 run with a three-pointer and Bogut capped the flurry with a layup to make it 85-72 with 4 1/2 minutes to go.
With the score 89-77 moments later, Milwaukee ripped off nine straight points. Ilyasova made a pair of free throws to give the Bucks a 98-77 lead with 1 1/2 minutes remaining.
"I told them I don't think they could've played any worse," Lakers head coach Phil Jackson said. "We stopped moving the ball. Their defense was good. Boykins played a great game."
Game Notes
LA defeated the Bucks, 118-107, back on November 16. The Lakers had won six straight in the series...Los Angeles fell to 10-3 at home this season...Bryant was ejected after receiving back-to-back technical fouls with 2:07 left in the game.

description.hltext_display: Iraq: Có Chính Phủ Mới, Sau 9 Tháng Bầu Cử
description.content:
; 9 Tháng Sau Bầu Cử, Gồm Hơn 40 Thành Viên Nội Các
BAGHDAD - Hôm Thứ Ba, chính phủ mới của Iraq đã tuyên thệ nhậm chức 9 tháng sau tổng tuyển cử, cho phép phe Shites tiếp tục nắm quyền lãnh đạo đất nước.
Nội các mới dưới quyền điều khiển của Thủ Tướng tại chức al-Maliki là 1 liên minh mong manh, với bất đồng nội bộ ngăn trở ông al-Maliki trong việc đề cử 1 số trong hơn 40 thành viên chính phủ.
Đối diện chính phủ mới vào lúc này là các thách thức rộng lớn và tốn kém gồm nhu cầu tái thiết sau 7 năm tàn phá của chiến tranh trong lúc bất đồng giáo phái thỉnh thoảng bùng nổ thành bạo động. 1 ưu tiên cấp bách của chính quyền Baghdad là trách nhiệm an ninh trong khi lực lượng Hoa Kỳ từ từ rút về.
Các nhà lập pháp đã chấp nhận 30 thành viên nội các - số còn lại trong 42 viên chức sẽ thay thế các quyền bộ trưởng sau, vì đang còn tranh luận giữa các phe nhóm trong liên hiệp.
Trước cuộc biểu quyết chuẩn thuận của QH, Thủ Tướng al-Maliki tuyên bố "Sứ mạng khó khăn nhất trên thế giới này là thành lập 1 chính quyền đoàn kết toàn dân tại 1 xứ sở đa dạng về chủng tộc, giáo phái và chính kiến". Ông hưá hẹn đánh khủng bố, giải tỏa các bất đồng giáo phái và chấn chỉnh quan hệ với các lân bang.
TT Obama mô tả sự thành hình nội các mới của Iraq là "giờ phút ý nghĩa" trong lịch sử Iraq và là 1 bước tiến tới quan trọng.
Trước cuộc biểu quyết của QH, cựu Thủ Tướng Allawi loan báo khối 91 dân biểu của đảng ông sẵn sàng hậu thuẫn và hợp tác. Ông Allawi đuợc cử điều khiển 1 cơ chế mới giám sát các vấn đề có liên quan với chính sách đối ngoại và an ninh. Trong thời gian qua, nhóm Iraqiya cương quyết đòi cho ông Allawi tổ chức nội các. Ông Allawi chỉ mới nhân nhượng sau khi đuợc cam kết rằng người của phe Sunni không bị gạt ra ngoài nội các.
Phe Sadrist chiếm 40 trong 325 ghế dân biểu cũng đồng ý hậu thuẫn do sự điều giải của Iran. Diễn biến này là ngạc nhiên bởi 2 phe là đối thủ từ năm 2008, khi Thủ Tướng al-Maliki mở chiến dịch đánh dẹp du kích Sadrist ở khu đông Baghdad và tại thành phố Basra thuộc miền nam.
Thủ Tướng al-Maliki hiện kiêm nhiệm các Bộ quốc phòng, nội vụ và an ninh - lãnh đạo của các Bộ này sẽ đuợc thương lượng sau.

description.hltext_display: 公路安全� �究院总监：双层巴士不宜斜坡行驶
description.content:
●南洋商报
（吉隆坡21日讯）大马公路安全研究院（MIROS）总监阿末法汉说，按照标准双层旅游巴士的结构因比普通巴士高，所以不适宜在斜坡行驶。
他对马新社说，巴士业者或公司在载着搭客到特定地点，尤其是斜坡地区时，都必须考虑巴士的结构是否适宜、巴士的性能，同时也要遴选适当的司机。
阿末法汉说，当局目前与数个执法及技术单位，包括警方、工程局、消拯局展开详细的调查工作，预估金马仑长巴严重车祸的调查报告两周内完成！

description.hltext_display: Mirafiori, accordo per Natale o via dall’Italia
description.author: Pierluigi Bonora
description.content: Potrebbe arrivare prima di Natale, come ripetutamente auspicato dal ministro del Lavoro, Maurizio Sacconi, laccordo tra Fiat e sindacati metalmeccanici (Fiom esclusa) su Mirafiori. Ieri, mentre Sergio Marchionne parlava ai 1.700 dirigenti del gruppo riuniti a Torino per il tradizionale scambio di auguri, Fim, Uilm, Fismic e Ugl hanno confermato di essere pronti ad accettare la sfida. Oggi, in mattinata, partir la richiesta di incontrare con urgenza la delegazione dellazienda, non oltre le prossime 48 ore. La risposta del top manager arrivata poco dopo: Laccordo su Mirafiori prima di Natale? Mi sembra unottima notizia. Speriamo di passare un buon Natale. Da qui linvito alla Fiom a firmare lintesa. Ieri, del resto, nel suo lungo intervento, Marchionne era stato ancora una volta chiaro: La decisione su Mirafiori non si pu posticipare allinfinito, ci sono scadenze industriali che premono e investimenti che devono partire al pi presto; spero prevalga il senso di responsabilit anche nel sindacato e che la proposta del 3 dicembre sia accolta per dare certezze ai nostri lavoratori e garantire loro un futuro sicuro. Marchionne ha quindi ricordato lessenza del piano di sviluppo di Mirafiori posto allattenzione di sindacati: La nostra proposta riflette lesigenza di Fiat di raggiungere un adeguato livello di competitivit nello stabilimento e, allo stesso tempo, attenta a conservare ogni tutela prevista dalla legge per i nostri lavoratori. una proposta che si realizza dando vita a una nuova societ per la quale necessario prevedere un contratto collettivo specifico. In caso di referendum tra le tute blu di Torino, Marchionne afferma poi che baster il 51% dei consensi al progetto Fiat per dare il via agli investimenti: La maggioranza dovrebbe dettare le condizioni per tutti. Con lamministratore delegato, a fare gli auguri ai dirigenti del gruppo, cera anche il presidente John Elkann il quale ha precisato la posizione dellazienda davanti ai Paese e, in particolare, alle sue radici italiane. E anche Elkann stato molto chiaro: Le nostre radici sono qui, a Torino e in Italia - ha commentato -: questa la nostra storia e da qui viene anche la nostra forza; ma ci non e non pu essere un vincolo che ci preclude il futuro. Siamo presenti e ci stiamo sviluppando nel mondo: vogliamo proseguire in questa direzione perch il nostro campo di gioco il mondo. Per i vertici del Lingotto, insomma, lopportunit che il Paese ha di fronte il classico treno che passa una volta sola. Non salirci, comporterebbe danni irreparabili. Non certo sfuggita laffermazione del giovane presidente secondo cui la storia e le radici non possono rappresentare un vincolo che possa condizionare il futuro del gruppo. lennesima dimostrazione di come la famiglia Agnelli, nel dare carta bianca a Marchionne, sia pronta a condividere anche quelle decisioni che sposterebbero il baricento del gruppo fuori dallItalia.

description.hltext_display: Mùi Lạ Khiến Đại Hội Đồng Lhq Di Tản
description.content:
Mùi Lạ Khiến Đại Hội Đồng LHQ Di Tản
NEW YORK - Phát ngôn viên Frahan Haq cho hay mùi khả nghi khiến cho HĐ Bảo An và Đại Hội Đồng của LHQ di tản hôm Thứ Ba.
Thông tấn xã AFP đưa tin: di tản là biện pháp dự phòng trong khi thẩm quyền LHQ và các viên chức an ninh của LHQ đang tìm kiếm nguồn gốc của mùi lạ. Các nhà ngoại giao nói tình nghi có xì hở hơi đốt ở tầng trệt của toà nhà LHQ.
Lệnh báo động phát ra ngay trước giờ bắt đầu 1 cuộc tranh luận đặc biệt tại HĐ Bảo An để nghe những trẻ em từ khắp thế giới lên tiếng quan ngại về các siêu cường. Số trẻ em này đuợc di tản qua trụ sở của phái đoàn Hoa Kỳ, bên kia đường.

description.hltext_display: Whittier families receive act of kindness
description.author: Sandra T. Molina Staff Writer
description.content:
From left, sisters Bianca, 9, Aleyna, 4, and Brianna Padilla, 10, and neighbor Luz Elena Gonzalez, 12, open their Christmas gifts from CareMore, a healthcare services company, at a transitional living resident in Whittier on Tuesday, Dec. 17, 2010. The families live in homes provided by Whittier Area First Day Coalition, which helps the homeless and at-risk individuals transition toward independence. (SGVN/Staff photo by Watchara Phomicinda/SWCity)
From left, sisters Bianca, 9, Aleyna, 4, and Brianna Padilla, 10, and neighbor Luz Elena Gonzalez, 12, open their Christmas gifts from CareMore, a healthcare services company, at a transitional living resident in Whittier on Tuesday, Dec. 17, 2010. The families live in homes provided by Whittier Area First Day Coalition, which helps the homeless and at-risk individuals transition toward independence. (SGVN/Staff photo by Watchara Phomicinda/SWCity)
WHITTIER - A local business got the jump on Santa Claus Tuesday night and delivered several bags filled with toys and other goodies to three local families.
About a dozen employees from Cerritos-based CareMore, a health-care services company, visited the home of Israel and Ana Padilla.
Photo Gallery: Whittier families receive holiday gifts
The Padillas, along with their four daughters, are living in a rented three-bedroom home on Newlin Avenue, property of the Whittier Area First Day Coalition.
The home is part of First Day's transitional housing complex, which also includes two-bedroom apartments.
CareMore officials wanted to sponsor a family for Christmas.
"It's an act of kindness for the holidays," said Theresa Martinez-Vargas, regional sales manager.
The word was sent out to the regional performance and sales teams in Whittier, and they responded with generosity.
"They stepped up and donated toys, school supplies and gift cards for the families," Martinez-Vargas said.
The Padilla, Sugges and Alcazar families appreciated their kindness.
"I am speechless," said Ana Padilla as she watched her girls open and look through the giant red bags. "Everyone is so kind."
The girls - Ashley, 15, Brianna, 10, Bianca, 9, and Aleyna, 4 - smiled as they gazed upon dolls, "Hello Kitty" gift sets, crayons, folders and other school supplies.
"I like it all," Bianca said.
Luz Elena Gonzalez, 12, and Cemone Banks, 3, who live with their moms in the two apartments, were also happy with their gifts.
"She likes to play with her stroller," Cemone's mom, Alera Sugges, said as her daughter held the toy stroller with its pink wheels. "Now she has her own little one for her doll."
The children weren't the only ones who received gifts.
Israel and Ana Padilla, Alera Sugges and Luz Elena's mom, Ana Maria Alcazar, received grocery and gasoline gifts cards.
"I can't thank them enough," Sugges said.
All the families, because of financial hardships, and in the case of Israel Padilla, medical issues, are taking part in First Day's transitional living program.
The families can stay in the residences up to three years, as long as they are low-income and are working, said Maria Alcala, First Day housing specialist and property manager.
"The program is our way of keeping families together, even as they go through tough times," she said.
Padilla suffered third-degree burns in a house explosion last December.
The damage to his body eventually led to the amputation of both his legs and several skin graphs on his hands and torso.
"I feel blessed to have so many people behind me and my family," Padilla said.

description.content: Plebiscytowe emocje nie sięgają jeszcze zenitu, ale powoli zbliżają się już do fazy, w której ważą się losy tytułów i wyróżnień. Odpowiedź na pierwszą zagadkę poznamy już 7 stycznia, bo wtedy poznamy zwycięzcę nowej kategorii, piłkarz amator. description.hltext_display: Israel: Phi Cơ Oanh Tạc Giết 7 Du Kích Tại Dải Gaza
description.content:
; Israel: Đặt Hệ Thống Nghênh Cảng Phi Đạn Bắn Từ Gaza Năm 2011
JERUSALEM - Trong 1 hoạt động lớn khác thường trước hừng đông ngày Thứ Ba, phi cơ Israel bắn 7 tình nghi du kích tại địa phận dải Gaza - du kích trả đũa bằng 1 hỏa tiễn bắn qua biên giới, rơi gần 1 vườn trẻ tại miền nam Israel.
Viên chức y tế của Gaza báo cáo 3 người Palestine bị thương trong các trận không tập của Israel. 1 cô gái Israel 16 tuổi bị thương vì trúng mảnh kín vỡ do hoả tiễn của Hamas gây ra.
Trong những ngày gần đây, bạo động leo thang ở biên giới, nơi 5 du kích bị giết hôm Thứ Bẩy.
Tại ủy ban ngoại giao và quốc phòng của QH Israel, Tướng tham mưu trưởng Gabi Ashkenazi mô tả tình hình biên giới là mong manh và bất ổn - ông nói "Không có gì bảo đảm an ninh biên biên giới sẽ không xấu hơn".
Du kích Hamas thường xuyên tấn công binh sĩ Israel dọc biên giới.
Tướng Ashkenazi xác nhận các hoạt động không tập trong đêm Thứ Hai rạng sáng Thứ Ba.
Bản tin quân sự của Israel ghi nhận các trận không tập nhắm đánh 1 cơ sở chế tạo vũ khí và đường hầm xâm nhập súng đạn từ Ai Cập sang Gaza.
Trong tuần này, du kích Hamas đã 13 lần bắn súng cối và hoả tiễn sang lãnh thổ Israel.
Trong buổi thuyết trình với các nhà lập pháp, Tướng Ashkenazi xác nhận 1 hệ thống phòng thủ mới có khả năng nghênh cản hoả tiễn bắn từ Gaza có thể bắt đầu hoạt động vào đầu năm 2011.

description.hltext_display: New Year: Party Punch IX | Submitted By: DeAnna Peal
description.content:
I made this for my friend's bridal shower and everyone kept asking, "Who made this punch?!" They all loved it! I used two packages of raspberry Jell-O and one package of strawberry Jell-O and cut the sugar back to about 2 cups -- and it was still plenty sweet. I divided the mixture (minus the ginger ale) into three gallon ziplock freezer bags and froze them. They were mostly hard, but not totally frozen about 15 hours after I put them in the freezer, and when I mixed it with the ginger ale (I used 1 bottle of ginger ale per bag of Jell-O mixture), it came out nice and slushy! The bride loved it so much she asked for the recipe and is using it for her wedding reception!
Was this review helpful? [ YES ]
321 users found this review helpful

description.hltext_display: Bắc H� n: Đồng Ý Thanh Tra Qt Đến Xem Cơ Sở Nguyên Tử
description.content:
Bắc Hàn: Đồng Ý Thanh Tra QT Đến Xem Cơ Sở Nguyên Tử; Nam Hàn: Sẵn Sàng Đánh Trả Nếu Bắc Hàn Tấn Công
ĐẢO YEONPYOENG - Một ngày sau cuộc thực tập pháo binh, Nam Hàn tung tàu chiến tuần thám hải phận và phi cơ bay yểm trợ phiá trên trong cuộc chuẩn bị trường hợp Bắc Hàn tấn công.
Bắc Hàn cho biết họ sẽ không trả đũa các cuộc luyện tập, ngược lại các lời lẽ đe dọa mấy hôm trước.
Nhưng, theo lời 1 viên chức Nam Hàn, Bắc Hàn không phản ứng không có nghĩa là họ đã lùi bước, và rằng chế độ Pyongyang muốn tấn công bất ngờ. Họ coi hải đảo nhỏ bé có làng chài và căn cứ quân sự trong tầm nhìn từ bờ biển của họ là thuộc lãnh thổ Bắc Hàn.
Hoạt động tập trận của Nam Hàn trong tháng qua đưa tới 1 trận pháo kích của Bắc Hàn, gây thiệt mạng 4 người trên đảo Yeonpyeong, là lần đầu tiên kể từ ngày đình chiến năm 1953 Bắc Hàn tấn công mục tiêu dân sự.
Thống đốc New Mexico, ông Bill Richardson, đang viếng thăm không chính thức Bắc Hàn, đã lên tiếng ca ngợi thái độ tự chế của Pyongyang. Vị cựu ĐS Hoa Kỳ tại LHQ tuyên bố tại Bắc Kinh hôm Thứ Ba rằng các viên chức Bắc Hàn đồng ý để thanh tra quốc tế trở lại xem cơ sở nguyên tử chính của họ để thấy Bắc Hàn không tinh chế uranium để làm bom nguyên tử. Theo lời thống đốc Richardson, thực tế này có thể là cơ hội tái tục các cuộc đàm phán giải giới nguyên tử. Pyongyang ngưng đàm phán 6 Phe từ Tháng 4-2009, và gần đây tỏ ý muốn nối lại cuộc thương lượng.
Tại thủ đô Hoa Kỳ, phát ngôn viên Bộ ngoại giao J.P. Crowley tuyên bố "Nếu Bắc Hàn nghiêm túc tiếp nhận thanh tra, hãy thông báo cho ủy ban nguyên tử năng quốc tế (IAEA) biết". Ông Crowley nhắc nhở "Họ thường nói nhiều, vấn đề thật là họ sẽ làm gì".
Tại thủ đô Seoul, các viên chức Nam Hàn biện giải các cuộc thao luyện, và xác nhận quân đội chuẩn bịï sẵn sàng đối phó hành động xâm lăng từ hướng bắc.
Bị 1 thành phần công chúng chê trách phản ứng chậm trong tháng qua, TT Lee đã dọa sẽ đánh trả Bắc Hàn bằng không quân. Hôm Thứ Ba, ông họp các cố vấn an ninh để bàn định chiến lược.
Bộ trưởng quốc phòng Kim Kwan-jin tuyên bố với các nhà lập pháp trước khi đi họp "Khi bị khiêu khích, chúng ta sẽ trừng phạt mạnh tay". Bộ trưởng Kim nhận rằng có áp lực yêu cầu ngưng tập luyện, nhưng cần trấn an quốc dân về an ninh bằng tinh thần vững chắc phù hợp với các biện pháp quân sự.
Bắc Hàn lên án cuộc thực tập pháo binh 90 phút của Nam Hàn là hành động khiêu khích tắc trách, nhưng không phản ứng. Trong khi đó thông tấn Yonhap dẫn 1 nguồn tin ẩn danh cho hay Bắc Hàn đã đưa hoả tiễn phòng không S-2 tới bờ tây, là nơi tranh chấp lãnh hải.
Bộ quốc phòng Nam Hàn xác nhận chiến đấu cơ tiếp tục các hoạt động không thám và khu trục hạm thế hệ Aegis sẵn sàng đối phó. Lực lượng bộ chiến tại ranh giới trên bộ đuợc lệnh cảnh giác - 1 cây giáng sinh bằng thép cao 100 feet đã đuợc thắp sáng, có thể dễ dàng nhìn thấy từ bên kia khu phi chiến. Nam Hàn đã bỏ lệ thắp sáng cây giáng sinh tại đường ranh đình chiến trong mấy năm trước vì Bắc Hàn coi như là hành động tuyên truyền và phản đối. Từ tối Thứ Ba, cây giáng sinh sáng đèn lại xuất hiện lần đầu tiên sau 7 năm trên đỉnh núi Aegibong.

description.hltext_display: Сделка, в совершении которой имеется заинтересованность
description.content:
Открытое акционерное Общество «Вторцветмет»
Сообщение о сведениях,
которые могут оказать существенное влияние на стоимость ценных бумаг акционерного общества

1. Общие сведения
1.1. Полное фирменное наименование эмитента Открытое акционерное общество «Вторцветмет»
1.2. Сокращенное фирменное наименование эмитента ОАО «Вторцветмет»
1.3. Место нахождения эмитента РФ, 392526, Тамбовская обл., Тамбовский р-н, пос. Строитель, ул. Промышленная, строение №6
1.4. ОГРН эмитента 1026800887365

description.hltext_display: В аварии под Великим Новгородом погибли три человека
description.content:
В результате столкновения двух автомобилей в Шимском районе Новгородской области погибли три человека. Как сообщили сегодня, 22 декабря, корреспонденту ИА REGNUM в пресс-службе областного управления ГИБДД, 21 декабря около 9:40 на 4 км автодороги Шимск - Феофилова Пустынь 30-летний водитель автомобиля ВАЗ-21099 столкнулся со встречным автомобилем ВМ-3284.
В результате аварии водитель и еще двое пассажиров в возрасте 30 лет и 41 года от полученных травм скончались на месте. Водитель ВМ-3284 и пассажир получили травмы и были доставлены в Шимскую ЦРБ.
По данным регионального управления ГИБДД, всего за сутки 21 декабря в Новгородской области зарегистрировано 9 дорожно-транспортных происшествий, в которых 5 человек погибли и 13 человек получили ранения, в том числе двое детей.

description.hltext_display: Broker Roundup: Jefferies initiates coverage of BG Group with a buy and £16 target
description.content:
Share on Facebook
* Jefferies initial coverage of BG Group with a buy and £16 target, its top pick in the EU gas and oil sector
* Credit Suisse upgrades Carillion to neutral from underperform with a 380p target
* Morgan Stanley has an equal-weight for FirstGroup, raising target to 420p from 385p, an underweight for Go-Ahead Group, raising target to £12.45 from £12, an overweight for National Express, raising target to 265p from 260p and has an overweight for Stagecoach, raising target to 232p from 205p
* Goldman Sachs has a buy for Topps Tiles, raising target to 110p from 83p, removes Randgold Resources from its pan-Europe Conviction Sell List, cutting target to £62.50 from £63 and has a neutral for AstraZeneca, cutting target to £33.50 from £35
* Citigroup upgrades Hochschild Mining to hold from sell with a 625p target and has a buy for Sports Direct, raising target to 200p from 165p
* Liberum Capital has a neutral for Next, cutting target to £21.50 from £23.75, a sell for Marks & Spencer, cutting targetto 360p from 375p, a neutral forKingfisher, raising target to 260p from 240p, a buy for Kesa Electricals, trimming target to 195p from 200p and a sell for Home Retail, cutting targt to 180p from 190p
* Execution Noble has a sell for HMV Group, slashing target to 20p from 50p
* FinnCap retains buy and 400p target for Catlin and has a hold for Begbies Traynor

description.hltext_display: Iraq: Cứu Giáo Dân
description.content:
BAGHDAD — Hội Ân Xá Quốc Tế hôm Thứ Hai kêu gọi chính phủ Iraq tăng nỗ lực bảo vệ tín đồ Thiên Chúa Giáo, sau khi 44 tín đồ bị giết cuối tháng 10 trong vụ tấn công vào một nhà thờ Baghdad.
Hội kêu gọi bảo vệ đặc biệt khi cộng đồng Thiên Chúa Giáo chuẩn bị mừng Lễ Giáng Sinh và có đe dọa tăng tốc khủng bố nhắm vào giáo dân và nhà thờ.
Malcolm Smart, giám đốc Ân Xá Quốc Tế vùng Trung Đông và Bắc Phi, nói trong bản văn rằng các tội ác chiến tranh như thế phải ngăn chận.
Nhóm 44 tín đồ Thiên Chúa Giáo, trong đó có 2 tu sĩ và 7 nhân viên an ninh, đã bị giết ngày 31-10-2010 sau khi một nhóm vũ trang chiếm ngôi nhà thờ ở Baghdad và rồi quân chính phủ Iraq phải xông vào giải cứu.
Nhóm Quốc Gia Hồi Giáo Iraq (ISI), một phân nhánh Al-Qaeda, đã nhận trách nhiệm vụ tấn công và đe dọa giáo dân Thiên Chúa mọi nơi sẽ là “mục tiêu chính đáng.”

description.hltext_display: Fog disrupts air, road traffic in China
description.content:
Related readings:
The fog rolled in Tuesday night, cutting visibility at the airport to 100 meters, which is below flying standards.
Flights gradually resumed Wednesday noon as the fog dispersed.
Fog also forced traffic authorities in southwest China's Sichuan province to close sections of its 10 highways Wednesday as visibility dropped to 50 meters in some regions.
Highway traffic slowly resumed after the fog began to lift at noon.
Fog also shrouded parts of Chongqing municipality, Guangxi Zhuang autonomous region and Guizhou province in Southwest China and Jilin province in Northeast China Wednesday morning, according to the Central Meteorological Center.
The center forecast more fog across the country in the coming few days.

description.hltext_display: Choosing From A Wide Array Of Options for a Corbett Safari Tour
description.content:
The Corbett safari tour takes you to the amazing surroundings of the ever popular Corbett National Park. This is perfect for the kids to enjoy and if you are a wildlife lover yourself. It would take you down to the deepest forest areas of the park where you can spend majority of your time reconciling with nature. To take a trip to the Corbett National Park by choosing from its many tour package options would be a once in a lifetime decision that you will not regret ever in your life.
The Corbett Safari Tour: The Corbett Safari Tour is usually set for 2 nights and 3 days. You will stay in their comfortable forest guest house where you can spend the night in the veranda and listen to the natural sounds made by the wild. You can be sure that the surroundings are safe since the forest house is surrounded with safety measure grids. You can also get to enjoy either an elephant or Jeep ride to appreciate the entirety of your surroundings.
Corbett Weekend Tour: This will also take you to the wildlife resort in the park where you will also get to spend 2 nights and 3 days. You will not just enjoy the wildlife but also the amenities of the forest house such as the cool and refreshing water of the swimming pool. On your second day, you will get to spend hours in the national park enjoying the wildlife and even taking the chance to take a bath in the Kosi River. You will have your breakfast before you even leave the resort as you head on to your next destination.
Corbett Tiger Tracing Tour Package: This will be one of the most exciting Corbett tour packages that you can ever experience in the national park. You will enjoy various meals from breakfast, lunch to dinner that is all sumptuous. As you look for the tigers, you will enjoy all the more since you will get the chance to ride the elephants. You will get to watch the entire wildlife scene in the park from a safe distance. All these and more are what you can offer to your family and friends who may be having the same level of passion for nature.
This is also perfect to be experienced by various organizations that fight for the preservation of environment and the wildlife creatures. Corbett safari will remain to be one of the best places you can ever find in the world!

description.hltext_display: Sashimi dan Sushi Oishii di Sushimise
description.content: Restoran Jepang yang mengusung menu-menu fushion ini memiliki keistimewaan tersendiri dari segi rasa. Mulai dari sashimi salmon yang memakai jenis ocean trout salmon yang berkualitas hingga aneka sushi roll yang memakai aneka bahan fresh. Pastinya semua serba oishii desu ne...!

description.hltext_display: Baleares se juega 37 millones de euros, un 0,2 por ciento más que en 2009
description.author: EUROPA PRESS
description.content:
EUROPA PRESS Los ciudadanos de Baleares se juegan un total de 37,06 millones de euros en el Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad de la Lotería Nacional, que se celebra desde las 09.15 horas en Madrid, lo que supone un ligero aumento de un 0,2 por ciento, en relación a 2009, cuando el gasto ascendió a 36,9 millones de euros. Así, el gasto por habitante se situó en 36,02 euros, frente a los 35,90 euros del pasado año, siendo de nuevo el más bajo de todo el Estado. Los ciudadanos de Baleares se juegan un total de 37,06 millones de euros en el Sorteo Extraordinario de Navidad de la Lotería Nacional, que se celebra desde las 09.15 horas en Madrid, lo que supone un ligero aumento de un 0,2 por ciento, en relación a 2009, cuando el gasto ascendió a 36,9 millones de euros. Así, el gasto por habitante se situó en 36,02 euros, frente a los 35,90 euros del pasado año, siendo de nuevo el más bajo de todo el Estado.
A nivel nacional, las ventas de Lotería han experimentado un descenso del 0,26 por ciento, en relación al año pasado. De este modo, la recaudación por las ventas asciende a 2.695,2 millones de euros, lo que supone un gasto medio por habitante de 59,74 euros, según los datos facilitados por el Organismo Nacional de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado (ONLAE).
El año pasado la cifra de ventas fue 2.703,2 millones de euros, es decir, 8 millones más. Por Comunidades Autónomas, las mayores inversiones se han registrado en Madrid y Cataluña, donde el gasto alcanzó los 450 y los 437 millones de euros, respectivamente, lo que supone un aumento del 1,88 por ciento y un descenso del 1,21 por ciento, respectivamente.

description.hltext_display: Stopgap spending measure clears Congress
description.content:
Congress cleared a stopgap funding bill Tuesday to keep the federal government open into March, a temporary truce until Republicans and President Barack Obama rejoin the battle over the budget next year.
The bill was passed by the House in the evening just hours after speeding through the Senate. Obama was poised to sign it by midnight to avoid a government shutdown.
The measure would freeze agency budgets at current levels. That's still too high for Republicans set to take over the House, who vow to cut many programs to levels in place when Obama took office. That will be difficult to achieve, even though Republicans will control the House and possess greater strength in the senate.
The bill would also create hardship at the Pentagon and the Homeland Security Department, which will be denied funding increases until their budgets pass next year.
The measure is needed because the Democratic-controlled Congress _ in an unprecedented failure to complete its most basic job on passing a budget _ has failed to enact a single one of the 12 annual spending bills that fund the day-to-day operations of every federal agency.
The House cleared the bill for Obama on a 193-165 vote after a 79-16 vote in the Senate.
Republicans promise to try next year to cut most domestic agency budgets back to pre-Obama levels. Such cuts would exceed 20 percent for some agencies.
Republicans say such cuts would produce savings of $100 billion compared to Obama's February budget request. But with the government operating at current levels for almost half of the fiscal year, the actual savings that Republicans might be able to accomplish are likely to be considerably smaller. The budget year began Oct. 1.
Republicans will have increased leverage, but Democrats will retain control of the Senate and the White House. The threat of a government shutdown is real if Democrats and resurgent Republicans can't agree.
In fact, additional stopgap spending measures may be needed next year if the battle drags on, as seems likely.
At issue is the approximately one-third of the budget passed each year by Congress to fund the 15 Cabinet departments and other agencies. The rest of the budget is dominated by benefit programs like Social Security, Medicare, and the Medicaid health care program for the poor and disabled.
Republicans haven't been very specific about which programs they want to cut next year, though they promise to rescind unspent money from last year's economic stimulus law, including billions of dollars for high-speed rail projects that critics say are likely to turn out to be boondoggles.
"Right now, there's a lot of posturing, a lot of slogans. I think they're going to go for a lot of quick, symbolic victories _ no earmarks, trying to recapture unspent stimulus," Sen. Barbara Mikulski, a liberal Democrat from Maryland, said of pet spending projects and the economic stimulus measure. "Then I think they'll start with women and children. And I will be combat ready."
The cuts are likely to come almost exclusively from domestic programs that have gotten boosts on the order of 10 percent a year since Obama took office.
Democrats warn that cutting spending is easier said than done.
"I think Republicans will discover that it's a lot easier to talk about cutting $100 billion than actually identifying the specific lines in the budget that they want to cut," said Sen. Tom Harkin, D-Iowa. "Do they really want to cut 21 percent from child care subsidies for working families _ in this economy? Do they really want to cut 21 percent from job training programs _ in this economy?"
An option under discussion among Republicans is to keep the domestic agencies running mostly on autopilot through next October but at lower spending rates.
At the same time, Republicans have promised to actually increase spending for the Pentagon and the Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security departments.
Senate Republicans last week blocked a move by Democrats to advance an almost $1.3 trillion spending bill to wrap up the unfinished budget work. The 1,924-page measure contained more than 6,700 home-state pet projects that Republicans have promised to give up.
The measure makes only a handful of funding adjustments from current levels, for example by cutting the Census budget way back since the decennial count has been completed.
It also implements Obama's recent proposal to freeze the salaries of federal civilian workers for two years.
The measure also provides $5.7 billion for the Pell Grant program, which provides grants of up to $5,550 to college students from low income families.

description.hltext_display: Warriors erase deficit, top Kings in OT
description.content:
Golden State overcame a 16-point fourth quarter deficit and Monta Ellis scored nine points in overtime, as the Warriors topped the Sacramento Kings, 117-109, at ARCO Arena.
Ellis scored a game-high 36 and Reggie Williams added 24 points for the Warriors, who got 15 points and 12 rebounds from David Lee.
Vladimir Radmanovic finished with 15 points off the bench -- including a game- tying three at the end of regulation -- for Golden State, which halted a two-game skid. Dorell Wright supplied 17 points, six rebounds and six assists in the win.
Beno Udrih led the Kings with a career-high 34 points and Tyreke Evans finished with 15 to go with 10 rebounds and seven assists for Sacramento, which has lost 14-of-15.
Carl Landry finished with 22 points and 10 rebounds in the loss.
"There's a line in this league when you think you can't get any lower, it gets lower," Kings head coach Paul Westphal said.
A Landry layup with 9:20 left in regulation gave the Kings a 94-78 lead. However, Radmanovic connected on a deep three at the other end to start an 18-4 Warriors run that stretched into the final seconds of play.
Ellis' short layup with 8:22 had Golden State within 94-83, and after Lee added two from the line, Wright and Ellis both connected on layups.
Evans made a layup of his own at the 4:21 mark to temporarily halt the Warriors' surge, making it a 96-89 game, but after the teams traded baskets, Ellis' bucket trimmed the deficit to five. Williams then made three of four from the charity stripe to cap the Sacramento run with 15.1 on the clock.
The Kings were up four, 102-98, after Udrih made two from the line with 8.1 seconds left, but a Williams free throw with 3.4 ticks remaining cut the margin to three. Williams missed his second try, but Golden State got the rebound, and Radmanovic's triple as time expired sent the game into overtime tied at 102.
Lee's three-point play with 1:25 left in overtime gave Golden State a 111-109 lead. After a Sacramento turnover, Ellis made two from the line. He scored the game's final six points in all -- four free throws and a layup -- as the Kings missed their final four shots down the stretch.
"I think our guys held true and we were able to make a lot of plays, defensive stops," Warriors head coach Keith Smart said. "That is what I am trying to get them to understand. They are good offensive players, but if they can get it into their hearts how hard it is to be a good defensive team, rebounding and making stops when they are necessary, then you are going to have a chance to have fun down the road."
Udrih scored 12 of the Kings' 18 first-quarter points, but the Warriors shot 64.7 percent from the field, en route to a 26-18 lead. Landry scored 13 in the second quarter as the Kings cut the Golden State lead to one, 49-48, at the intermission.
The Warriors' lead was as high as six in the opening minutes of the third, but after a Landry free throw about midway through tied the game at 61 and keyed a 12-2 run.
Udrih's pullup jumper with 3:37 left ended the spurt and put the Kings up 72-63. Francisco Garcia added a three and a layup in the final 31 seconds to put Sacramento up 84-70 heading to the fourth.
Game Notes
Landry's 22 points tied a season-high...Donte Greene scored 10 points and Cousins grabbed 13 rebounds with seven points in the loss...Sacramento won the rebounding margin 56-48...The Warriors converted on 11-of-12 fast break opportunities for 31 points.

description.hltext_display: Ángel María Villar y Vicente del Bosque, premiados en la Gala del Deporte de Arganda del Rey
description.content:
RFEF - 21-12-2010
El Presidente de la RFEF recibirá una Mención Especial del Jurado y el Seleccionador Nacional ha sido nombrado “Titán de Oro”. Ambos compartirán premio con diferentes deportistas y entidades deportivas. El acto se celebrará en la tarde de este jueves 23 de diciembre en la localidad madrileña.
El Jueves 23 de diciembre se celebrará la XV Gala del Deporte de Arganda del Rey, donde se reconocerán los méritos deportivos de los mejores deportistas y entidades deportivas del año 2010, acto que tendrá lugar a partir de las 19.00 horas, en el Auditorio Monserrat Caballé.
Los premiados, que esta edición se anuncian antes de celebrar la gala, son:
-Mejores Equipos Escolares: Benjamín Masc. Escuela de Fútbol Arganda y Milagrosa Alevín F.S.
-Mejor Deportista Escolar: Alberto Pinilla (tenis).
-Mejor Deportista Fed. Fem. Deporte Individual: Cristina Moyano (Natación).
-Mejores Deportistas Fed. Masc. Deporte Individual: Jorge Martín Lozoya (Natación); Gonzalo de Arcos (Atletismo) y Diego Banet (Patinaje).
-Equipo Local Federado: Cadete A. Esc. Fútbol; Alevín A. U.D. Poveda; Infantil A. C.F. Boca Juniors; y Juvenil Fem. Esc. Fútbol Sala.
-Ascenso a Categoría Nacional: Senior Fem. C.B. Arganda.
-Mención Labor Integración: Comunidad Educativa C.E.I.P. Miguel Hernández.
-Menciones Especiales: Delegados Deportes AMPAS; Presidentes Clubes; Ángel María Villar (Presidente RFEF); y José Luis Sáez (Presidente FEB).
Además, este año, el Titán de Oro ha recaído en la persona de Vicente del Bosque, en el Club Atlético de Madrid, y en la Selección Española Femenina de Baloncesto, de acuerdo a la decisión de un Jurado formado por Medios de Comunicación, Clubes Deportivos, Representantes de Asociaciones de Padres y Madres de Alumnos y Técnicos Deportivos del municipio. Los galardones serán entregados por el Alcalde de Arganda del Rey, Pablo Rodríguez.

description.hltext_display: Flæskestegen er sikret til julen
description.content:
De statsansatte tilsynsteknikere har genoptaget arbejdet på slagterierne og bragt slagtninger i normal gænge.
Julens flæskesteg er sikret. De statsansatte tilsynsteknikere på slagterierne har nemlig genoptaget arbejdet efter de seneste dages arbejdsnedlæggelser, oplyser slagterikoncernen Danish Crown.
Det betyder, at der igen slagtes som normalt for årstiden på alle svineslagterier. Strejken betyder dog, at Danish Crown må skubbe en pukkel på omkring 40.000 slagtesvin foran sig.
- Med ganske få undtagelser landet over har vi sikret, at de danske forbrugere, der gerne vil have svinekød på bordet til jul, også får det, siger kommunikationsdirektør Anne Villemoes, Danish Crown.
- Men situationen har skabt problemer, når vi ser på forsyningerne til verdensmarkedet, og det repræsenterer et meget alvorligt problem for en virksomhed som Danish Crown, tilføjer hun.
Situationen er gået hårdt ud over Danish Crowns ejere. En del landmænd, der leverer dyr til slagterierne, har oplevet, at de ikke har kunnet få hentet dyr til slagtning - og det giver dyrevelfærdsmæssige problemer.
- Vi kan godt forstå landmændenes frustration over, at den samme styrelse, der kontrollerer og uddeler bøder i forbindelse med dyrevelfærd, omkostningsfrit kan skabe problemer for dyrene, siger Anne Villemoes.
Kun tilsynsteknikerne på aftenholdet i Blans er der usikkerhed om onsdag formiddag.

description.hltext_display: Stop polarizing our discourse
description.content:
Why is it so difficult to have meaningful debate on health-care reform or environmental conservation measures in Canadas political arena, despite the importance of such issues and the desperate need for action on both fronts?
Ironically, the answer appears rooted in a positive aspect of our national character. Canadians are generally a moderate and tolerant people thus the quickest way to publicly discredit a political opponent in debating an important issue is to characterize that opponents position as extreme.
So Candidate Jones declares that she favours national health-care standards enforced by the federal government a reasonable position, whether or not you agree with it. Candidate Smith, however, reacts in mock horror to this suggestion. I cant believe it! Jones wants to trample on the constitutional rights of the provinces and establish a federal dictatorship over health care.
Do we see what Smith is doing? Hes not debating the merits or weaknesses of Joness actual position hes ignoring it altogether. Instead, he takes Joness position, pushes it to the extreme, then argues against that extreme.
Smith then declares that he favours a health-care system offering universal coverage but both public and private health-care insurance, financing and delivery. Whether or not we agree with this position, it isnt an unreasonable one, since more than two dozen industrialized countries offer their citizens such a system.
So how does Jones react to this suggestion? This time, its her turn to feign mock horror. I cant believe it! Smith wants to privatize and Americanize the Canadian health-care system.
Once again, do we see what Jones is doing? Shes not debating the strengths or weaknesses of Smiths actual proposal shes ignoring it altogether. Instead, she takes Smiths position, pushes it to the extreme, then argues against that extreme.
Within minutes, what was supposed to be a rational debate on an issue of great concern to Canadians has degenerated into a debate between a federal health-care dictatorship versus a privatized American-style health-care system options that neither of the candidates nor their parties believe in or advocate. No wonder Canadian voters observing such phony debates time and time again throw up their hands in disgust and conclude that its impossible to have an intelligent discussion on real health-care reform options in the political arena.
This disgust is even greater when the same thing happens to public debate over issues such as environmental conservation. Candidate Jones and her party are accused of wanting to destroy the economy in the name of environmental protection. Candidate Smith and his party are accused of wanting to destroy the environment in the name of economic development extreme positions that neither candidate nor party supports but that become the focus of any public debate on the environment. No wonder were witnessing declining public faith in political institutions and democratic processes, including elections, when this type of debate becomes the dominant feature of our political discourse.
So what to do? Three suggestions: First, lets recognize that this is whats going on a national virtue, the tolerance and moderation of Canadians, is being turned into a liability for short-term political gains. Thus, whenever you hear a public figure or their positions being routinely characterized by their opponents and the media as extreme, think twice. There are political extremists in Canadian politics, but 90 per cent of the time, such accusations are false.
Second, if youre ever called on to chair an all-candidates debate during an election or a political roundtable at a conference, and the Hes an extremist, shes an extremist exchange breaks out, dont just sit there stop the proceedings. Show the audience exactly whats going on and threaten to shut down the debate if it continues. Ive done this, and its been my experience that you wont get halfway through your rant before the audience will begin to nod and even applaud sending a clear message to the debaters that such inane discourse is unacceptable.
Third, recognize that confrontational, polarized debate between alleged extremes is more newsworthy in the eyes of most media than moderate, nuanced debate over real positions. So heavily discount media reports of political debates, especially during elections, and go to source for information on the actual positions of the parties and the candidates. In the Internet age, this is much more feasible for the average citizen than ever before.
Preston Manning, the former leader of the old Reform Party from Alberta, retired from Parliament in 2002 and is now the first president and chief executive officer of the Calgary-based Manning Centre for Building Democracy, a federally registered non-profit organization founded in 2005. It operates as a conservative think tank oriented, in its own description, to equip future political leaders with the ideas, skills and networks necessary to make a principled and effective contribution to Canadian politics

description.hltext_display: Pemegang proksi diminta hadir sendiri pada EGM PLUS
description.content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Pemegang saham PLUS Expressways Bhd yang mengemukakan borang proksi mereka, seharusnya menghadiri sendiri mesyuarat agung luar biasa (EGM) esok.
Begitu juga dengan syarikat yang melantik proksi perlu menghantar wakil mereka seperti yang sepatutnya bagi menghadiri dan mengundi bagi penangguhan atau resolusi, katanya dalam makluman kepada Bursa Malaysia hari ini.
PLUS berkata lembaga berhasrat mengemukakan cadangan pada EGM itu untuk menangguhkan mesyuarat.
"Penangguhan sedemikian akan tertakluk kepada kebenaran pemegang saham sekarang ini dan yang layak mengundi pada EGM itu," katanya.
Sementara itu, Pengarah Urusan/Ketua Pegawai Eksekutif UEM Group Bhd Datuk Izzaddin Idris berkata syarikat akan mematuhi keperluan yang diumumkan PLUS.
Izzaddin berkata demikian kepada pemberita selepas EGM UEM Land Holdings Bhd di Petaling Jaya hari ini.
UEM Group Bhd dan Kumpulan Wang Simpanan Pekerja telah mengemukakan tawraan bersama sebanyak RM23 bilion manakala Jelas Ulung Sdn Bhd pada RM26 bilion untuk mengambil alih PLUS. - BERNAMA

description.hltext_display: 09:57'Windows 8 gaat ARM-processoren ondersteunen'
Viking Line vahvisti laivatilauksen Turun telakalta
description.content:
Jarmo Seppälä, 10:55
Viking Line on vahvistanut laivatilauksen Turun telakalta. Varustamoyhtiön ja STX Finlandin välinen laivanrakennussopimus tulee voimaan tänään, kun osapuolet sopivat sopimusehdoista.
Yksi ehdoista koski ympäristötukea, josta liikenne- ja viestintäministeriö päätti eilen. Tuen maksaminen edellyttää, että Euroopan unionin komissio hyväksyy tukiohjelman ja Viking Linen tukihakemuksen.
Lokakuussa allekirjoitettu aiesopimus saatetaan näin voimaan. Sopimus sisältää option toisesta laivasta. Investointi on noin 240 miljoonan euron arvoinen.
Alus rakennetaan Turun telakalla, ja se tulee Turku–Ahvenanmaa–Tukholma-reitille. Laivan arvioidaan valmistuvan vuoden 2013 alussa.
Uusi laiva on noin 214 metriä pitkä ja sen bruttovetoisuus on 57 000 tonnia. Jääluokka on 1 A Super.
Alus on suunniteltu 2 800 matkustajalle ja sitä operoi 200 hengen miehistö. Matkustajahyttejä laivassa on 880.
Aluksessa on rekkakaistoja 1 275 metriä, ja henkilöautoille on tilaa noin 500 metriä erillisellä autokannella.
"Olemme kiitollisia hankkeemme saamasta, monien eri yhteistyökumppaneiden ja -tahojen tuesta sekä erityisen iloisia siitä, että pystymme näin joulun alla lupaamaan uutta työtä tuhansille ihmisille Turun seudulla", toimitusjohtaja Mikael Backman Viking Linelta sanoo tiedotteessa.
Uuden risteilijän rakentaminen merkitsee telakkayhtiölle noin 2 600 henkilötyövuotta.

description.hltext_display: Intel gets FTC nod for McAfee deal
description.content:
LOS ANGELES: Intel Corp has won approval from the for its proposed $7.68 billion acquisition of security specialist McAfee Inc, the chipmaker said.
Intel said it was continuing to cooperate with the European Commission's review of the deal.
European Union officials appear concerned that McAfee could gain privileged access to security features on Intel's microprocessor chips, which could give McAfee an advantage over rivals, the reported last week.
"I'm not anticipating any trouble on that front," said Alex Gauna, an analyst with JMP Securities.
"My supposition here is that it is simply taking a bit more time overseas than here, and obviously Intel has had its recent wrangling with the European Union, which may be throwing just another dimension of complexity into the process," he said.
The EU levied a record fine of 1.06 billion euro ($1.39 billion) against Intel in May 2009 for illegally shutting out rival Advanced Micro Devices Inc.
On Tuesday, Intel said on its website, "The has concluded its review of the proposed McAfee transaction and has cleared it."
It added, "We are continuing to work with the staff at the European Commission as they continue their review."
Gauna, who has a "market outperform" rating on Intel, said that with the industrywide shift to cloud computing where sensitive data is moved online, security is a chief concern and Intel's acquisition of McAfee would bolster its efforts in that area.

description.hltext_display: The Importance Of Marriage
description.content:
Author : James Gardener
Marriage is a special union of male and female orchestrated by God himself Before man's civilization, there was no ceremony done nor any paper signed by both parties to legalize their union But as years passed man has learned to come up with legalities as to both parties' rights and privileges including marital benefits and properties
You are fully aware that marriage is not only a legalization of your sexual relationship but also a sanctification of your union regardless of your religion, values or beliefs It is also taking into consideration the impact of that sense of belongingness for your children and your children's children This is a pathway of building a family which is the basic unit of society
Common law marriage based on divine sanctification has no difference with religious marriage Both are accepted in the divine perspective as well as in our society However, the solemnity of its ceremony obviously differs There is a strong conviction on both persons involved that you are meant to be; united for divine purpose and glorification; and you will both abide faithfully with each other till death part your ways when you get married on a Christian - based marriage covenant
When a man commits to marry a woman in a religious ceremony the meaning and importance are of great impact so that no temptations nor trials along the way could ever destroy the relationship Divorce can't be considered a better alternative Nothing and no one can ever dare separate what has been joined together by such Holy matrimony and were considered one flesh with the evidence of marriage certificate
The civil marriage, however, should have been supposedly grounded by the same convictions and impact But the authority that solemnizes the marriage plays a vital role in the union of two individuals
Frequently, when it's a common law marriage there is no counseling involved Especially when both parties merely wanted that legalities of being together for the sake of the baby or to be safe from the public's ridicule The person solemnizing the ceremony should be involved much in guiding the two individuals how to live life as one When this is not done, it can result to a broken future
The most important essence of marriage is not whether it's civil nor religious, what matters most is both parties are faithfully committed to each other grounded by true love
You can find wedding favor goodies here, do not just click and order anywhere. Find one trusted company to provide your wedding favor boxes .

description.hltext_display: 塑胶模型厂入贼遭掳走 东主头伤昏迷垃圾场
description.content:
●南洋商报
（加影21日讯）加影一间塑胶模型工厂昨日凌晨入贼，工厂东主连人带车遭掳走，今早被人发现躺在芙蓉巴音垃圾场，昏迷不醒。
失踪的东主为41岁的刘志明，已婚且育有两名女儿。据悉，伤者被路人发现时，头后部严重受伤，大量失血，不排除是遭硬物攻击，已被送往吉隆坡中央医院，等候进行手术。
等候动手术
据了解，伤者妻子已确认丈夫的身分，其丈夫头部受重伤，需要动手术。
这起打劫掳人案，发生在昨日午夜12时许，在加影9英里的一间小型工业区。
雪州刑事调查主任莫哈末阿南受询时指出，至傍晚时分失踪的东主和其丰田四轮驱动车，仍下落不明。 警方已成立专案小组调查。
他说，警方暂援引抢劫导致他人受伤的条文展开调查。
加影警区刑事调查主任罗兹警监指出，初步调查相信此案动机纯粹抢劫，遭劫走的是工厂内价值两三千令吉的铜模。
据悉，失踪的东主经常留在在工厂工作制凌晨时分，周日未有返家，当时家人也没起疑。直到其胞兄周 一早上前往工厂时，发现锁头不见，厂内遭匪爆窃及无法联络上弟弟时，才前往警局报案。
据了解，警方在现场调查时，在现场发现一滩血迹。
